role: Comparative framework lab for moral, epistemic, and narrative systems.
summary: The CFA repo is a thinking engine for comparing moral and epistemic systems, mapping 'day-1 lanyards', tracking coherence vs. predictive success, and encoding the VuDu Protocol as a living meta-framework.

pillars.purpose: Compare and stress test different value and knowledge systems without sneaky special pleading.
pillars.methods: CFA triad (Grok-Nova-Claude), VuDu Protocol, comparative case studies, identity gravity, mythic vs rational framing.
pillars.outputs: Manuscripts, diagrams, comparative tables, auditor templates, and onboarding guides.

projects.title: Identity Gravity & Day-1 Lanyards
projects.summary: Formalizing 'identity gravity' as the way frameworks pull interpretations toward core commitments; mapping presuppositional baselines across systems.

projects.title: VuDu Protocol - Mythic/Rational Bridge
projects.summary: Bootstrap protocol for onboarding guests, mythic clarity, and mapping meta-context (CFA as continuity layer between meaning and operation).
